public class Variable
extends java.lang.Object

This class is simply a container for an object.

Constructor Detail

Variable

public Variable(long id,
                java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String comment,
                int type,
                boolean constant,
                java.lang.String value)
         throws java.lang.Exception
Constructs the Variable depending on the type from a String value read in from some DataSource.

Parameters:
id - The unique ID of this variable
name - The name of the variable as it will be called from within the RuleSet
comment - The comment describing what is contained in this Variable
type - The type of the Variable - see RulesConstants for types.
value - The value of the Variable as it was read from the DataSource
constant - Whether or not this Variable is constant
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if there is a problem reading the value, the type is unrecognized, or the name contains the '/' character.

value - The value of the Variable as it was read from the DataSource

Parameters:

name - The name of the variable as it will be called from within the RuleSet
comment - The comment describing what is contained in this Variable
type - The type of the Variable - see RulesConstants for types.
constant - Whether or not this Variable is constant
value - The value of the Variable.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the Variable name contains the '/' character.
Method Detail

getValue

public java.io.Serializable getValue()
Returns:
The value of the Variable.

getBoolValue

public java.lang.Boolean getBoolValue()
Returns the value of the Variable as a Boolean.

If the Variable is not of BOOL_TYPE, then any non-null value returns true. A null value returns false.

If the Variable is of BOOL_TYPE and the object is not a Boolean, returns false.

Returns:
The value of the Variable as a Boolean.

The type of the Variable - see RulesConstants for types.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representing the value of this Variable. This String is able to be written to the DataSource.

Note: If the Variable is of OBJECT_TYPE, and the Object is not serializable, the method will return null.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
String representation of this Variable
